t: Psalm 40
Faith Persevering in Trial
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
I*pn waited patiently for the Lord;*s And*ld He inclined to me, And*ld heard my cry.
He*ld also brought me up out of a horrible pit, Out*ld of the miry clay, And*ld set my feet upon a rock, And*ild established my steps.
He*ld has put a new song in my mouth— Praise*ld to our God; Many*ld will see it*i and fear, And*ld will trust in the Lord.*s
Blessed*ln is*i that man who makes the Lord*s his trust, And*ld does not respect the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

Many,*ld O Lord*s my God, are*i Your wonderful works Which*ild You have done; And*ld Your thoughts toward us Cannot*ld be recounted to You in order; If*ild I would declare and speak of*i them,*i They*ld are more than can be numbered.
Sacrifice*ln and offering You did not desire; My*ld ears You have opened. Burnt*ld offering and sin offering You did not require.
Then*ld I said, “Behold, I come; In*ld the scroll of the book it*i is*i written of me.
I*ld delight to do Your will, O my God, And*ld Your law is*i within my heart.”
I*ln have proclaimed the good news of righteousness In*ld the great assembly; Indeed,*ld I do not restrain my lips, O*ld Lord,*s You Yourself know.

I*ld have not hidden Your righteousness within my heart; I*ld have declared Your faithfulness and Your salvation; I*ld have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth From*ld the great assembly.
Do*ln not withhold Your tender mercies from me, O Lord;*s Let*ld Your lovingkindness and Your truth continually preserve me.
For*ld innumerable evils have surrounded me; My*ld iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; They*ld are more than the hairs of my head; Therefore*ld my heart fails me.
Be*ln pleased, O Lord,*s to deliver me; O*ld Lord,*s make haste to help me!
Let*ld them be ashamed and brought to mutual confusion Who*ld seek to destroy my life; Let*ld them be driven backward and brought to dishonor Who*ld wish me evil.
Let*ld them be confounded because of their shame, Who*ld say to me, “Aha, aha!”
Let*ln all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; Let*ld such as love Your salvation say continually, “The*ld Lord*s be magnified!”
But*ld I am*i poor and needy; Yet*ild the Lord*s thinks upon me. You*ld are*i my help and my deliverer; Do*ld not delay, O my God.
